boone

Class Trainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • boone.Trainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackpropTrainer, HebbTrainer, HopfieldDeltaTrainer, SOMTrainer

    public abstract class Trainer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, Storable
    The trainer super class for all training algorithms.
    Version:
    $Id: Trainer.java 2296 2018-04-16 12:29:15Z helmut $
    Author:
    August Mayer, Helmut A. Mayer

      java.lang.String toString()

      Writes attributes to XML.
      void train()
      Performs training in the following order: - sets the training flag - calls reset(), if not step mode - runs through the number of epochs presenting each pattern by calling train(java.util.List, java.util.List) - after each epoch endEpoch() is called, then training data are shuffled (setShuffle(boolean)) - after all epochs are done, endTrain() is called - the training flag is reset
      protected abstract void train(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> inputPattern, java.util.List<java.lang.Double> targetPattern)
      Trains a single pattern once.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Trainer clone()
        Return a deep clone of this object. The clone has set the Network reference to null; this needs to be initialized. The name is taken unchanged from the original object; we assign a new ID, however.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • getTrainingData

        public PatternSet getTrainingData()
        Returns the training data set.
        Returns:
        a pattern set

      • setTrainingData

        public void setTrainingData(PatternSet trainingData)
        Sets the training data set.
        Parameters:
        trainingData - a pattern set

      • getTestData

        public PatternSet getTestData()
        Returns the programs data set.
        Returns:
        a pattern set

      • setTestData

        public void setTestData(PatternSet testData)
        Sets the programs data set.
        Parameters:
        testData - a pattern set

      • setStepMode

        public void setStepMode(boolean stepMode)
        Sets the step mode. If set, the trainer assumes that training is done in steps of the number of epochs set. Hence, a next call to train() continues the training, if step mode is set. If it is not set, the next call to train() is a new training procedure.
        Parameters:
        stepMode - the mode flag

      • setShuffle

        public void setShuffle(boolean shuffle)
        Sets the shuffle flag. If set, the training set is shuffled after each epoch.
        Parameters:
        shuffle - if true, shuffle training data

      • train

        public void train()
        Performs training in the following order: - sets the training flag - calls reset(), if not step mode - runs through the number of epochs presenting each pattern by calling train(java.util.List, java.util.List) - after each epoch endEpoch() is called, then training data are shuffled (setShuffle(boolean)) - after all epochs are done, endTrain() is called - the training flag is reset

      • test

        public double test(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> input,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.Double> target)
        Test a given input pattern and return the programs error. Default implementation: set the input pattern, innervate the network, call calcError(target) to get the error.
        Parameters:
        input - Input pattern.
        target - Desired output pattern
        Returns:
        Test error (as provided by calcError).

      • test

        public double test()
        Returns the error on the test data.
        Returns:
        sum of errors per test pattern

      • calcError

        public double calcError(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> target)
        Calculate the network error.
        Parameters:
        target - desired target output
        Returns:
        error, by default, the sum squared error (SSE)

      • getNetwork

        public NeuralNet getNetwork()
        Returns:
        the Network of this Trainer.

      • setNetwork

        public void setNetwork(NeuralNet net)
        Sets the network for this trainer.
        Parameters:
        net - a neural net

      • setLearnRate

        public void setLearnRate(double learnRate)
        Set the learn rate for this Trainer. The concrete meaning of this value depends on the Trainer implementation.

        Parameters:
        learnRate - the learning rate for this Trainer.
        See Also:
        learnRate

      • getLearnRate

        public double getLearnRate()
        Returns the learning rate of the trainer. The concrete meaning of learning rate depends on the Trainer implementation.
        Returns:
        0.0 (it should return the learning rate in concrete trainers).
        See Also:
        learnRate

      • getEpochs

        public int getEpochs()
        Return a default number of training cycles. This number is not used internally by Boone, because the number of cycles is specified explicitly at every train() function call. The user can use this value at his discretion.
        Returns:
        Some default number of training cycles.
        See Also:
        epochs

      • setEpochs

        public void setEpochs(int epochs)
        Sets the number of epochs. An epoch is a single presentation of all training patterns.
        Parameters:
        epochs - the number of epochs
        See Also:
        epochs

      • getTrainingSignalGenerator

        public TrainingSignalGenerator getTrainingSignalGenerator()
        returns the current training signal generator for this trainer. A trainer may or may not use this generator, depending on the implementation.

      • setTrainingSignalGenerator

        public void setTrainingSignalGenerator(TrainingSignalGenerator trainingSignalGenerator)
        set the training signal generator for this trainer. A trainer may or may not use this generator, depending on the implementation.

      • getWinningNeuron

        public Neuron getWinningNeuron(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> input)
        Returns the output neuron with largest activation upon presentation of 'input'.
        Parameters:
        input - an input pattern
        Returns:
        the winning neuron
